Perceptor:

"My Precious base!!!" Yelled with anger Perceptor while all the=
 base alarms Rang, the lights of sections of the base turn off "YOU WILL PA=
Y FOR THIS RODENT WITH YOUR LIFE!!!!! UNLESS YOU WANT TO MURDER THe FEMME, =
YOU SHOULD STOP TO MESS WITH MY PRECIOUS BASE!!!"

Full of anger Perceptor =
Typed some buttons and Swarm of mini robots, they were bigger as a normal r=
at, who ran through the pipers, this little bots looked like mechinical spi=
ders; they had a little laser and they were usually used to repair the wire=
s and the pipers. 20 of those little critters appeared, the half of them st=
arted to repair the wires and the other half to hunt rattrap.

"Rodimus... =
Go to this sector and watch out that our enemies doesnt go inside" typed Pe=
rceptor fast and send the secret message "They mustnt get her... Do what ev=
er you have to to stop them"

the sector that Perceptor mentiones was the p=
lace where Nightlight was

DarkHawk:

Darkhawk Strumble backwards and set h=
is hand in his jaw, now full anger burns in his spark. 

"LOCK DOWN!!!"

A =
large thick metal door slide down thill the button , and Darkhawk said cold=
ly "You wont leave this place alive, no matter if you tell us somthing or n=
ot..."

From: Sandy 
Sent: Thursday, February 25, 2010 1:54 PM
To: nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Quickstr=
ide nodds his head in compliance to Lord Elder and rears up on his hind hoo=
ves.

"Yes Sir! QUICKSTRIDE, MAXIMIZE!"

Within moments he transforms into =
his robot mode and runs off in the directon of the shuttle. Even on two fee=
t he proves swift and wastes no time in getting to his destination.

At the=
 fortress, Rat Trap re establishes his connection to Lord Elder.

"Sorry, r=
an inta interference, I'm back online Lord Elder. I'm about a quarter of th=
e way through the base's pipe system. But those uglies ain't givn' up on me=
. I gotta do somethn' ta distract 'em... Now let's see.... If I was these g=
uys what would I be worried about? Hmmm, well, defenses for the most part, =
and then any circuitry related ta power, computer systems.... That's it. I =
bet if I can find a few electrical ports I might be able ta pull some plugs=
 here 'n there.."

He uses his nose to smell for a faint electrical smell. =
He catches it and crawls into an area where he finds a few fine wires. They=
're live, as he senses.

"Paydirt. Okaaay uglies, now this is where I be ge=
tting my sweet revenge. I dunno what does what, but I bet if I cut one of t=
hese, or a few, I'll find out." 

With his buck teeth, he nibbles at a few =
wires, and manages to snap several. He waits to see what happens.

Torture =
Chamber...

Tucson did not say a word. Yet his expression says many. His op=
tics narrowed sharply at Darkhawk's statement, this would yet be another po=
wer surge, due to a shortness in temper, which often was the case because h=
e had not always expressed his anger and kept it in, most of the time. He w=
as also fed up with Scorponok's obnoxious behavour as well. He balls up one=
 fist, and manages to get some power into his all wheel drive system to cre=
ate another power grip on his hand, thus expanding his wrist and putting st=
rain on his restraints. It gets to the point where hydraulic pressure units=
 within his arms, finally swell to the point where the restraint on the lef=
t hand is broken off his arm. with that, he now gives himself a free hand a=
nd without another word, he manages to give Darkhawk a very nasty blow to h=
is jaw with a loud smack. 

" You just don't know when to shut up do you?!"=


Anger. Anger was one of the things Tucson had wished he never had to show=
 but now was forced into his current mood by Darkhawk and Scorponok, yet mo=
st of his anger he concentrates into his binds on the torture device, one h=
and and one leg at a time, concentrating the all wheel drive power into the=
se areas, which conserves needed energy for the rest of the body. 

" Nothi=
ng will make me fold to either one of you. And yes, I'm not done fighting y=
et if that's what you two think. So before you make snap judgements of me, =
I caution you two to not judge a bot by his frame." 

His backup energy sup=
ply kicks in giving him just enough energy to transform into SUV mode. He s=
tarts up his engine and waits for his enemie's reaction.

--- In nbwrpg@yah=
oogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> OOC: Actually =
that was Scourge's blast - but cool :)
> 
> > He starts to send Lord Elder =
the data relating to his position and location.
> >
> > "Sorry, I had ta ye=
ll because of the sound of the energy blasts. Okay, here's the skinny sir, =
we got three trapped Autobots. Night Light who's unconcious, my new pal, Tu=
cson, who came here tryn' ta save Rodimus's life, even though that lousey h=
eap of scrap doesn't deserve it for the treachery he's committed lately and=
 yeah I am reffern' ta Rodimus Prime. ACK! Lousey no good GLITCH! Look, I'l=
l tell ya more when I can get outa here, that's if I get outa here."
> >
> =
> His transmission breaks after his last word.
> 
> "Rat Trap!" He depresse=
s a control upping the transmission power
> slightly, "Rat Trap, come in!"
=
> 
> Lord Elder looked over at Quickstride for a moment, his optics
> thoug=
htful, "Yes of course" he said in a somewhat distracted manner.
> He looked=
 back at the display screens as the alert from Legacy also
> played over hi=
s communication channels as well . . .
> 
> "We are under attack! PREPARE"
=
> 
> "Blast!" Lord Elder said as he oriented sensors in the direction of
> =
the Old Maximal Base, "The Maximal base is under attack!" he said. Not
> th=
at he had seen any actually firepower exchanged, but he knew how
> Minions =
were.
> 
> He glanced back at the computer screen, a pensive look on his fa=
ce.
> "God!' he said. "The Predacons are not taking advantage of this
> dis=
traction to attack. Perhaps they have problems of their with Rat
> trap the=
re."
> 
> "Quickstride, go get the shuttle prepped for launch. We don't hav=
e the
> numbers to fully attack the Dark Fortress, but maybe we can provide=

> enough of a distraction so Rat Trap can escape, and maybe even rescue
> =
this Tuscon that Rat trap spoke of."
> 
> Even as he spoke, Lord Elder was =
working to bring the Ark's defenses
> online. There had been a shield here,=
 and he and legacy had been
> working to get it in place before all this ha=
ppened. Now would be the
> time to put it through it's tests.
> 
> (Tag)
> =

> Preston
> (Lord Elder)
>
